intro: Lysimachia clethroides var. crassifoliosa, commonly known as broadleaf yellow waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and blooms. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to wetland restoration projects.
